title: Projects
text:
Developed advanced neural network models to classify animal species from camera trap images, aiding scientists in tracking wildlife populations.



Built a convolutional neural network (CNN) to classify crop diseases into five categories, improving accuracy using transfer learning and callbacks.



Extended object detection models to process real-time video feeds, detecting vehicles and pedestrians for urban traffic analysis.



Designed GANs to generate synthetic medical images for training augmentation; deployed with Streamlit.



Used stable diffusion to create an interactive meme generation app for marketing campaigns.



Implemented a GARCH time-series model to forecast stock volatility; integrated with APIs for automated prediction delivery.

title: About
text:
Hi, I am Ayush Kumar
I am a Data Science professional with a passion for building intelligent, data-driven systems that bridge the gap between theoretical research and real-world applications. My journey into data science began with a strong foundation in Computer Science and Engineering (B.Tech., First Division with Honours, CGPA 9.021) at Echelon Institute of Technology, and has evolved into a specialized focus through my M.Tech. in Data Science at the Defence Institute of Advanced Technology, Pune (CGPA 9.0).
Over the years, I have developed expertise across the machine learning ecosystem, spanning:
- Core Concepts: Supervised & unsupervised learning, deep learning architectures, NLP, computer vision, time-series forecasting, and statistical modelling.
- Specialized Areas: Generative AI, federated learning, physics-informed models, vector similarity search, A/B testing, and feature engineering.
- Practical Skills: Python, SQL, C, Java, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, NumPy, Pandas, Plotly, Tableau, Streamlit, Docker, MySQL, MongoDB, and API integration.

title: About
text:
Research & Academic Contributions
My research is driven by the belief that data science should not only be cutting-edge but also grounded in real-world constraints. For my masterâ€™s thesis, I developed a Physics-Informed Diffusion-Based Framework for Enhancing Underwater Images in High Turbidity Conditions, combining deep learning with physical modelling to address challenges in marine imaging. I have also published in peer-reviewed venues, including the National Conference on Communications (NCC 2025), where I presented work on the performance of state-of-the-art underwater image enhancement models.
